text: chicken salad is one of those great
staples to have on hand in your fridge
awesome and sandwiches over salads but
so often it's just laden with
unnecessary fat so this is a really
great healthier version start with four
boneless skinless chicken breasts just
going to rub them with a little bit of
olive oil here and then season them with
salt I have my pan heating here on
medium heat and I'm adding just a slight
amount of olive oil just enough to coat
the bottom cook a chicken breasts until
they're golden and cooked through which
will be about 12 minutes we're going to
flip them halfway it's been about six
minutes
chicken is smelling wonderful let's give
it a flip let's let it cook for another
six minutes hey chicken is cooked so
we'll transfer this to a plate so we'll
let that you can stand for about 10
minutes so it's nice and juicy let's
work on our delicious creamy base start
with an apple Granny Smith I'm leaving
the skins on lots and lots of nutrients
in the skin just take out the cord I
think a nice hit of sweetness balances
out that really savory chicken flavor
this is a great one for the fall because
there's all those really delicious
varieties of apples at the farmers
market so don't limit yourself to Granny
Smith branch out try to front apple now
for the herbs in this salad I'm going to
use tarragon because I'm also using
chopped fennel and the tarragon has a
really nice sort of annecy flavor I
think it goes so beautifully with
chicken so I'm going to chop up about a
tablespoon of fresh tarragon one of the
great reasons to use fresh herbs besides
their flavor is that you don't need to
use quite as much salt or fat plus
tarragon just goes so wonderfully with
chicken we're going to throw some chives
to shooting for about two tablespoons
now we're going to add some grapes again
more sweetness with our granny smith
apple here we're shooting for two cups
these I'm just going to have their
little large
okay so let's start on our dressing
we're not going to use mayonnaise today
instead we're going to use yogurt start
by adding 3/4 cup plain yogurt to that
the juice of half a lemon which is
probably about a tablespoon or so can
always add more to taste now for the
crunchy stuff about a cup of chopped
fennel half a cup of chopped celery
about a tablespoon of Dijon mustard
again this is just going to add more
tang enos Dijon mustard goes so
beautifully with chicken give this a
stir
okay so let's add our apples grapes and
the herbs now let's chop up the chicken
so this has been resting you don't want
to lose any of this this is super
flavorful so just go ahead and add these
juices to your dressing chop the chicken
breasts into about half inch pieces you
can also pull them if you want a
shredded chicken instead nice and juicy
just the way we like it
so let's add this seasoned with salt and
pepper give it a good stir this looks so
wonderful creamy so this would be great
on a bed of greens I'm going to serve it
on some pumpernickel bread pumpernickel
is just bread made with coarse rye flour
so it has a nice nutty flavor
cut a few slices for a lovely open-faced
sandwich so add a couple of handfuls of
watercress you can also use baby spinach
this kind of a salad sandwich combo a
nice helping of our chicken salad serve
this chicken salad immediately or throw
it in the fridge for a couple days the
flavors will only improve straw bite mmm
super creamy very delicious who needs
the mayo here
